text.p: These are the leading stories in the Belgrade press on Wednesday. Reuters has not verified them and does not vouch for their accuracy.
NASA BORBA
- Serbian Opposition leaders visit Madrid, Spain offers aid to Serbian health sector
- Belgrade textile, leather workers say they are owed 11 months' back pay
- Health sector stages one-hour warning strike
- Yugoslav authorities to crack down on independent media by limiting imports of newsprint
- Yugoslav authorities plan to tighten controls on visits by foreign delegations
POLITIKA
- Teachers' trade union decides to call off strike
- Montenegrin president says in letter to U.S. congressmen that cooperation with Serbia's president is his principal political objective
- Yugoslav automotive manufacturers say state must protect them against uncontrolled imports of foreign cars
- Environmental catastrophe averted in chemical plant in Sabac, western Serbia, after vinyl-chloride leak
- Montenegrin TV breaks off re-broadcast of Belgrade TV news commentary lambasting Montenegrin Prime Minister
- Serbian media scene: three new dailies being prepared
DNEVNI TELEGRAF
- Yugoslav National Bank has already printed 100-dinar notes, preparing 500 and 1,000 dinar bills
- Serbian opposition to begin new wave of protests on March 9 demanding media liberalisation
POLITIKA EKSPRES
- Yugoslav aircraft manufacturer Lola-Utva to begin production of Utva-96 light four-seater this year
DEMOKRATIJA
- Student protest in Belgrade nears 100th day, university rector resists all demands for resignation
- Belgrade newsroom +381 11 2224305
